item.title: Python Type Conversion
item.description: Types Variables in Python are dynamically-typed: declared without an explicit type. objects have a type, so Python knows the type of a variable. No char in Python! Both ' and " create string literals type(1) # <class 'int'> type(1.0) # <class 'float'> type(2/1) # <class 'float'> type("hello") # <class 'str'> type('a') # <class 'str'> type(True) # <class 'bool'> type(None) # <class 'NoneType'> type(int) # <class 'type'> type(type(int)) # <class 'type'> type(print) # <class 'builtin_function_or_method'> bool is a subtype of int, where True == 1 and False == 0 True == 1 # True False == 0 # True True == 2 # False True or False # True (short-circuits) Truthy and Falsy # 'Falsy' bool(None) bool(False) bool(0) bool(0.
